de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.slicing

Class StaticSlicingCriterion

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.slicing.StaticSlicingCriterion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SlicingCriterion

    public class StaticSlicingCriterion
extends Object
implements SlicingCriterion
    Representation of a static slicing criterion. Each slicing criterion may match an arbitrary number of dynamic instruction instances, originating from an arbitrary number of static instructions.
    Author:
    Clemens Hammacher

      • parse

        public static StaticSlicingCriterion parse(String string,
                           List<de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.ReadClass> readClasses)
                                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Parses and returns a slicing criterion consisting of a class name, method name, line number (optional), occurence number (optional), and variable definitions (optional). The form of the given string to represent the slicing criterion is as follows: It always starts with a location in the form fullyQualifiedClassName.methodName, possibly followed by :lineNumber. If no line number is given, the criterion matches as soon as the first instruction of the specified method is executed, which would be the last instruction of the method when traversing the trace backwards. After the specification of the location, there can be given a set of local variables covered by the slicing criterion, in the form :{var1,var2,var3} where var1...var3 must be the names of local variables occuring in the given method. To cover all local variables, you can also specify :*. In total, the slicing criterion could look like this:
        • java.lang.String.indexOf:1768:{target,max}
        Parameters:
        string - the input string specifying a slicing criterion
        readClasses - the list of all classes of the trace result (see TraceResult.getReadClasses())
        Returns:
        the parsed slicing criterion
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a problem with the input string is encountered. this could be that the overall form did not match, or that the class, method, line number or local variable(s) did not exist

      • parseAll

        public static List<SlicingCriterion> parseAll(String string,
                              List<de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.ReadClass> readClasses)
                                       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Parses a sequence of comma separated slicing criterion, given in a string. See parse(String, List)
        Parameters:
        string - the input string specifying the slicing criteria (at least one), comma separated
        readClasses - the list of all classes of the trace result (see TraceResult.getReadClasses())
        Returns:
        a list of all slicing criteria parsed
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a problem with the input string is encountered. this could be that the overall form did not match, or that a class, method, line number or local variable(s) did not exist
